name: ResponsiveDonation

methods.name: create_event

args.name: event_string
args.desc: Description of the event (e.g., "Hurricane hits Miami")

args.name: oracle_address
args.desc: Address authorized to resolve this event

returns.desc: The event ID of the created event (uint64)

methods.desc: Create a new event that can be used for conditional donations.

methods.name: instantaneous_payout

args.name: recipient_address
args.desc: Address to receive the donation (charity/recipient)

args.name: payment
args.desc: The payment transaction (must be grouped with the app call)

returns.desc: True if the donation is successful

methods.desc:
Process an immediate donation with instant payout to recipient.
Perfect for direct charitable giving with immediate impact.

methods.name: create_conditional_donation

args.name: event_id
args.desc: The event this donation depends on

args.name: recipient_yes
args.desc: Address to receive funds if event resolves to true

args.name: recipient_no
args.desc: Address to receive funds if event resolves to false (often donor)

args.name: payment
args.desc: The payment transaction (funds held in escrow)

returns.desc: The clause ID of the created conditional donation

methods.desc:
Create a conditional donation that will pay out based on event resolution.
Example: "Donate $1000 to Red Cross IF hurricane hits Miami, otherwise return to me"

methods.name: mixed_donation

args.name: instant_recipient
args.desc: Address to receive instant donation (use zero address if no instant donation)

args.name: instant_amount
args.desc: Amount for instant donation (use 0 if no instant donation)

args.name: event_id
args.desc: Event ID for conditional donation

args.name: recipient_yes
args.desc: Address to receive funds if event resolves to true

args.name: recipient_no
args.desc: Address to receive funds if event resolves to false

args.name: payment
args.desc: The payment transaction covering both donations

returns.desc: The clause ID for the conditional donation created

methods.desc:
Create both instantaneous and conditional donations in a single transaction.
Simplified version that handles one conditional donation to keep it simple.

methods.name: resolve_event

args.name: event_id
args.desc: The event to resolve

args.name: resolution
args.desc: The outcome of the event (true/false)

returns.desc: True if the event is successfully resolved

methods.desc: Resolve an event outcome. Can only be called by the authorized oracle.

methods.name: execute_conditional_clause

args.name: clause_id
args.desc: The clause to execute

returns.desc: True if the clause is successfully executed

methods.desc:
Execute a conditional clause after its associated event has been resolved.
Can be called by anyone to trigger payouts.

args.name: event_id
args.desc: The event ID to query

returns.desc: The EventStruct containing the event's information

methods.name: get_clause_info

args.name: clause_id
args.desc: The clause ID to query

returns.desc: The ConditionalClauseStruct containing the clause's information

methods.desc: Get information about a conditional clause.

methods.name: get_pending_events

returns.desc: Array of pending event IDs (empty for now - placeholder for interface)

methods.desc:
Get all pending event IDs. Oracle can use this to know which events to monitor.
Note: This is a simplified version - in production you'd want pagination for large numbers of events.

methods.name: get_clauses_for_event

args.name: event_id
args.desc: The event to get clauses for

returns.desc: Array of clause IDs that depend on this event (empty for now - placeholder)

methods.desc:
Get all clause IDs that depend on a specific event.
Oracle can call this when resolving an event to get all clauses to execute.

desc:
ResponsiveDonation Contract - MVP Version
    
    A smart contract enabling conditional charitable donations based on real-world events.
    Perfect for disaster relief, climate action, and cause-based giving.
    
    Core Features:
    1. 💰 Instantaneous Donations - Direct donations with immediate payout
    2. 🎯 Conditional Donations - "Donate $1000 to Red Cross IF hurricane hits Miami"
    3. 🔮 Oracle Resolution - Trusted oracles resolve event outcomes
    4. 🚀 Mixed Donations - Combine instant + conditional in one transaction
    5. 📊 Query Interface - Discover events and clauses
    
    Use Cases:
    - Climate disaster relief (donate if hurricane/wildfire occurs)
    - Charity matching (donate if fundraising goal is met)
    - Sports betting for good (donate to charity if team wins)
    - Political action (donate if legislation passes)

sourceInfo.errorMessage: Conditional amount must be greater than 0
Event has not been resolved yet
Index access is out of bounds
Only authorized oracle can resolve event
Payment amount must be greater than 0
Payment amount must equal sum of donations
Payment must be sent to contract
Payment sender must match transaction sender
can only call when not creating
